sentences.zh: 〈《山海經》云：「太戲之山，滹沱之水出焉。

translations.literal: Classic of Mountains and Seas says: "Taixi mountain, Hutuo water exits there.
translations.idiomatic: (The Classic of Mountains and Seas states: "The Hutuo River originates from Mount Taixi.")

sentences.zh: 」在今代州繁畤縣東，流經定州深澤縣東南，即光武所度處，今俗猶謂之危度口。

translations.literal: At today Daizhou Fanshi county east, flows passes Dingzhou Shenze county southeast, is Guangwu what crossed place, today common still call it Wei Du Kou.
translations.idiomatic: (Mount Taixi is located east of present-day Fanshi County in Daizhou. The river flows southeast past Shenze County in Dingzhou, which is where Emperor Guangwu crossed; even today, locals still refer to that spot as the "Dangerous Crossing.")

sentences.zh: 臣賢案：呼沱河舊在饒陽南，至魏太祖曹操因饒河故瀆決，令北注新溝水，所以今在饒陽縣北。

translations.literal: Servant Xian note: Hutuo river formerly at Raoyang south, reach Wei Taizu Cao Cao because Rao river former ditch burst, ordered north flow New Ditch water, therefore today at Raoyang county north.
translations.idiomatic: (Commentary by your servant, [Li] Xian: The Hutuo River used to be south of Raoyang, but during the time of Cao Cao, Emperor Taizu of Wei, the old Rao River channel burst, and he ordered the river to be diverted northward into the "New Ditch"; consequently, the river is now located north of Raoyang County.)

sentences.zh: 無船，適遇冰合，得過，

translations.literal: No boat, just then met ice joined, able cross,
translations.idiomatic: There were no boats available, but it just so happened that the river had frozen over, allowing them to cross.

sentences.zh: 〈《續漢書》曰：「時冰滑馬僵，乃各以囊盛沙，布冰上度焉。

translations.literal: Continued Book of Han says: "Time ice slippery horse stiff, then each with bag hold sand, spread ice on cross there.
translations.idiomatic: (The Continued Book of Han states: "At that time, the ice was so slippery that the horses were stiff with fear; consequently, they filled bags with sand and spread it over the ice so they could cross.")

sentences.zh: 未畢數車而陷。

translations.literal: Not finished several carriages and sank.
translations.idiomatic: Just as the last few carriages were crossing, the ice gave way and they sank.

sentences.zh: 進至下博城西，

translations.literal: Advanced reached Xiabo city west,
translations.idiomatic: They advanced until they reached the west of Xiabo City,

sentences.zh: 〈下博，縣，屬信都國。

translations.literal: Xiabo, county, belongs to Xindu state.
translations.idiomatic: (Xiabo was a county belonging to the Principality of Xindu.)

sentences.zh: 在博水之下，故曰下博。

translations.literal: At Bo river below, therefore called Xiabo.
translations.idiomatic: (It was named Xiabo because it was situated downstream from the Bo River.)

sentences.zh: 故城在今兾州下博縣南。

translations.literal: Former city at today Jizhou Xiabo county south.
translations.idiomatic: (The former city is located south of present-day Xiabo County in Jizhou.)

sentences.zh: 遑惑不知所之。

translations.literal: Alarmed confused not know where go.
translations.idiomatic: and they were so alarmed and confused that they did not know which way to go.

sentences.zh: 有白衣老父在道旁，

translations.literal: Had white clothed old father at road side,
translations.idiomatic: An old man dressed in white was by the side of the road,

sentences.zh: 〈老父蓋神人也，今下博縣西猶有祠堂。

translations.literal: Old father probably spirit person also, today Xiabo county west still has ancestral temple.
translations.idiomatic: (The old man was likely a divine being; even today, there is still a shrine dedicated to him west of Xiabo County.)

sentences.zh: 指曰：「努力！

translations.literal: Pointed said: "Exert effort!
translations.idiomatic: He pointed the way and said, "Press on!

sentences.zh: 信都郡為長安守，去此八十里。」

translations.literal: Xindu commandery for Chang'an guards, distance this eighty li."
translations.idiomatic: Xindu Commandery is still holding out for the central government in Chang'an, and it is only eighty li from here."

sentences.zh: 〈信都郡，今兾州也。

translations.literal: Xindu commandery, today Jizhou also.
translations.idiomatic: (Xindu Commandery is present-day Jizhou.)

sentences.zh: 光武即馳赴之，信都太守任光開門出迎。

translations.literal: Guangwu immediately galloped went-to it, Xindu Grand Administrator Ren Guang opened gate exited welcomed.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Guangwu immediately galloped toward it, and Ren Guang, the Grand Administrator of Xindu, opened the gates and came out to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 世祖因發旁縣，得四千人，先擊堂陽、貰縣，皆降之。

translations.literal: Shizu then mobilized side counties, got four thousand people, first attacked Tangyang, Shi counties, all surrendered them.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Guangwu then mobilized troops from the neighboring counties, raising four thousand men. He first attacked the counties of Tangyang and Shi, both of which surrendered to him.

sentences.zh: 〈堂陽及貰並屬鉅鹿郡。

translations.literal: Tangyang and Shi both belong to Julu commandery.
translations.idiomatic: (Tangyang and Shi both belonged to Julu Commandery.)

sentences.zh: 堂陽在堂水之陽，今兾州縣，故城在今兾州鹿城縣西南。

translations.literal: Tangyang at Tang water's north, today Jizhou county, former city at today Jizhou Lucheng county southwest.
translations.idiomatic: (Tangyang was located on the north bank of the Tang River; it is a county in present-day Jizhou, and its former city is southwest of Lucheng County in Jizhou.)

sentences.zh: 貰音時夜反。

translations.literal: Shi sound shi-ye fan.
translations.idiomatic: (The character shi [in the name of Shi County] is pronounced shi.)

sentences.zh: 王莽和成卒正邳彤亦舉郡降。

translations.literal: Wang Mang Herong Muzheng Pi Tong also raised commandery surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Tong, the Grand Administrator (muzheng) of Herong under Wang Mang, also surrendered the entire commandery.

sentences.zh: 〈《東觀記》曰：「王莽分鉅鹿為和成郡。

translations.literal: Dongguan Ji says: "Wang Mang divided Julu into Hecheng commandery.
translations.idiomatic: (The Records of the Eastern Pavilion states: "Wang Mang divided Julu into Hecheng Commandery.")

sentences.zh: 」卒正，職如太守。

translations.literal: Muzheng, post like Grand Administrator.
translations.idiomatic: (The title muzheng was equivalent in rank to a Grand Administrator.)

sentences.zh: 又昌城人劉植，宋子人耿純，

translations.literal: Also Changcheng person Liu Zhi, Songzi person Geng Chun,
translations.idiomatic: Additionally, Liu Zhi of Changcheng and Geng Chun of Songzi,

sentences.zh: 〈昌城，縣，屬信都國，故城在今兾州西北。

translations.literal: Changcheng, county, belongs to Xindu state, former city at today Jizhou northwest.
translations.idiomatic: (Changcheng was a county belonging to the Principality of Xindu; its former city is northwest of present-day Jizhou.)

sentences.zh: 宋子，縣，屬鉅鹿郡，故城在今趙州平棘縣北。

translations.literal: Songzi, county, belongs to Julu commandery, former city at today Zhaozhou Pingji county north.
translations.idiomatic: (Songzi was a county belonging to Julu Commandery; its former city is north of present-day Pingji County in Zhaozhou.)

sentences.zh: 各率宗親子弟，據其縣邑，以奉光武。

translations.literal: Each led clan relatives sons younger-brothers, occupied their counties towns, to serve Guangwu.
translations.idiomatic: each led their clansmen and younger relatives to occupy their respective counties and towns in service to Emperor Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 於是北降下曲陽，

translations.literal: Thereupon north surrendered Xiaquyang,
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, he moved north and accepted the surrender of Xiaquyang,

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬鉅鹿郡。

translations.literal: County name, belongs to Julu commandery.
translations.idiomatic: (Xiaquyang was a county belonging to Julu Commandery.)

sentences.zh: 常山郡有上曲陽，故此言下。

translations.literal: Changshan commandery had Shangquyang, therefore this speaks Xia.
translations.idiomatic: (Since Changshan Commandery had a county named Shangquyang [Upper Quyang], this one is referred to as Xiaquyang [Lower Quyang].)

sentences.zh: 衆稍合，樂附者至有數萬人。

translations.literal: Crowd gradually joined, happy followers reached had several ten thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: His forces gradually gathered, and those who were eager to join him eventually numbered in the tens of thousands.

sentences.zh: 復北擊中山，

translations.literal: Again north attacked Zhongshan,
translations.idiomatic: He again struck northward to attack Zhongshan,

sentences.zh: 〈中山，國，一名中人亭，故城在今定州唐縣東北。

translations.literal: Zhongshan, State, one name Zhongren Pavilion, former city at today Dingzhou Tang county northeast.
translations.idiomatic: (Zhongshan was a Principality, also known as Zhongren Pavilion; its former city is located northeast of present-day Tang County in Dingzhou.)

sentences.zh: 張曜中山記曰：「城中有山，故曰中山。

translations.literal: Zhang Yao Zhongshan Ji says: "City within has mountain, therefore called Zhongshan.
translations.idiomatic: (Zhang Yao's Records of Zhongshan states: "There is a mountain within the city, which is why it is called Zhongshan [Middle Mountain].")

sentences.zh: 拔盧奴。

translations.literal: Captured Lunu.
translations.idiomatic: and captured Lunu.

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬中山國，故城在今定州安喜縣。

translations.literal: County name, belongs to Zhongshan state, former city at today Dingzhou Anxi county.
translations.idiomatic: (Lunu was a county belonging to the Principality of Zhongshan; its former city is in present-day Anxi County in Dingzhou.)

sentences.zh: 水經注曰：「縣有黑水故池，水黑曰盧，不流曰奴，因以為名。

translations.literal: Shui Jing Zhu says: "County has black water former pond, water black called Lu, not flow called Nu, because take-as name.
translations.idiomatic: (The Commentary on the Water Classic states: "The county contains the ancient Black Water Pond; since black water is called lu and stagnant water is called nu, it was named accordingly.")

sentences.zh: 所過發奔命兵，

translations.literal: What passed mobilized benming troops,
translations.idiomatic: Wherever he went, he mobilized the "emergency response" (benming) troops,

sentences.zh: 〈《前書》音義曰：「舊時郡國皆有材官、騎士，若有急難，權取驍勇者聞命奔赴，故謂之『奔命』。

translations.literal: "Former Book" Yin Yi says: "Old time commanderied states all had talent officials, knights, if had urgency disaster, temporarily took brave ones hear order run go-to, therefore called them 'Ben Ming'.
translations.idiomatic: (The Notes on the Pronunciation and Meaning of the History of the Former Han states: "In former times, the commanderies and principalities all maintained skilled infantry and cavalry; in times of extreme urgency, the most valiant men were temporarily recruited to respond immediately upon receiving orders, which is why they were called 'those who run to their orders' (benming).")

sentences.zh: 移檄邊部，共擊邯鄲，郡縣還復響應。

translations.literal: Moved manifesto border regions, together attack Handan, commanderies counties again responded.
translations.idiomatic: He issued manifestos to the border regions, calling for a joint attack on Handan, and the various commanderies and counties once again responded with support.

sentences.zh: 南擊新市、真定、元氏、防子，皆下之，

translations.literal: South attacked Xinshi, Zhending, Yuanshi, Fangzi, all surrendered them,
translations.idiomatic: Moving south, he attacked Xinshi, Zhending, Yuanshi, and Fangzi, and forced them all to surrender.

sentences.zh: 〈新市，縣，屬鉅鹿郡，故城在今恒州東北。

translations.literal: Xinshi, county, belongs to Julu commandery, former city at today Hengzhou northeast.
translations.idiomatic: (Xinshi was a county belonging to Julu Commandery; its former city is northeast of present-day Hengzhou.)

sentences.zh: 元氏、房子，屬常山郡，並今趙州縣也。

translations.literal: Yuanshi, Fangzi, belong to Changshan commandery, both today Zhaozhou counties also.
translations.idiomatic: (Yuanshi and Fangzi belonged to Changshan Commandery; both are counties in present-day Zhaozhou.)

sentences.zh: 防與房古字通用。

translations.literal: Fang and Fang ancient characters common used.
translations.idiomatic: (The character fang [in Fangzi] was used interchangeably with the character fang [house] in ancient times.)

sentences.zh: 因入趙界。

translations.literal: Then entered Zhao border.
translations.idiomatic: He then entered the territory of the Principality of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 時王郎大將李育屯柏人，

translations.literal: Time Wang Lang great general Li Yu stationed Bairen,
translations.idiomatic: At that time, Wang Lang's grand general Li Yu was stationed at Bairen.

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬趙國，今邢州縣，故城在縣之西北。

translations.literal: County name, belongs to Zhao state, today Xingzhou county, former city at county's northwest.
translations.idiomatic: (Bairen was a county belonging to the Principality of Zhao; it is in present-day Xingzhou, and its former city is northwest of the current county seat.)

sentences.zh: 漢兵不知而進，前部偏將朱浮、鄧禹為育所破，亡失輜重。

translations.literal: Han troops not know and advanced, front part partial generals Zhu Fu, Deng Yu by Yu what broken, lost lost supply-train.
translations.idiomatic: The Han troops advanced without being aware of the situation, and the generals of the vanguard, Zhu Fu and Deng Yu, were defeated by Li Yu, losing their entire supply train in the process.

sentences.zh: 光武在後聞之，收浮、禹散卒，與育戰於郭門，大破之，盡得其所獲。

translations.literal: Guangwu at back heard it, collected Fu, Yu scattered soldiers, with Yu fought at outer-wall gate, big broke them, completely got what their what obtained.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Guangwu heard of this from the rear, he collected the scattered troops of Zhu Fu and Deng Yu and engaged Li Yu at the outer city gates. He decisively defeated Li Yu and recovered all the supplies that had been captured.

sentences.zh: 育還保城，攻之不下，於是引兵拔廣阿。

translations.literal: Yu returned protected city, attacked it not down, thereupon led troops captured Guang'e.
translations.idiomatic: Li Yu retreated to defend the city, and since Emperor Guangwu could not capture it immediately, he led his troops instead to capture Guang'e.

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬鉅鹿郡，故城在今趙州象城縣西北。

translations.literal: County name, belongs to Julu commandery, former city at today Zhaozhou Xiangcheng county northwest.
translations.idiomatic: (Guang'e was a county belonging to Julu Commandery; its former city is northwest of present-day Xiangcheng County in Zhaozhou.)

sentences.zh: 會上谷太守耿況、漁陽太守彭寵

translations.literal: Met Shanggu Grand Administrator Geng Kuang, Yuyang Grand Administrator Peng Chong
translations.idiomatic: It so happened that Geng Kuang, the Grand Administrator of Shanggu, and Peng Chong, the Grand Administrator of Yuyang,

sentences.zh: 〈上谷，郡，故城在今媯州懷戎縣。

translations.literal: Shanggu, commandery, former city at today Guizhou Huairong county.
translations.idiomatic: (Shanggu was a commandery; its former city is in present-day Huairong County in Guizhou.)

sentences.zh: 漁陽，郡，在漁水之陽，今幽州縣。

translations.literal: Yuyang, commandery, at Yu water's north, today Youzhou county.
translations.idiomatic: (Yuyang Commandery was located on the north bank of the Yu River; it is present-day Youzhou County.)

sentences.zh: 各遣其將吳漢、寇恂等將突騎來助擊王郎，

translations.literal: Each sent their generals Wu Han, Kou Xun etc lead tuqi come help attack Wang Lang,
translations.idiomatic: They each sent their generals, including Wu Han and Kou Xun, leading their elite "assault cavalry" (tuqi) to assist in the attack against Wang Lang.

sentences.zh: 〈突騎，言能衝突軍陣。

translations.literal: Tuqi, mean able dash-into-clash military array.
translations.idiomatic: (The term tuqi [assault cavalry] refers to cavalry capable of charging into and breaking enemy formations.)

sentences.zh: 更始亦遣尚書僕射謝躬討郎，

translations.literal: Gengshi also sent Shangshu Puye Xie Gong punish Lang,
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gengshi also dispatched the Supervisor of the Secretariat (shangshu puye) Xie Gong to suppress Wang Lang.

sentences.zh: 〈漢官儀曰：「尚書四員，武帝置，成帝加一為五。

translations.literal: Han Guan Yi says: "Shangshu four members, Wu Emperor established, Cheng Emperor added one to five.
translations.idiomatic: (The Ceremonies of Han Officials states: "The Secretariat (shangshu) consisted of four members, established by Emperor Wu; Emperor Cheng added one more, making five.")

sentences.zh: 有常侍曹尚書，主丞相御史事；

translations.literal: Has Changshi Cao Shangshu, master Chancellor Censor-in-chief matters;
translations.idiomatic: (The Director of the Imperial Attendants Bureau supervised matters related to the Chancellor and the Censor-in-Chief.)

sentences.zh: 二千石尚書，主刺史、二千石事；

translations.literal: Two-thousand-picul Shangshu, master Inspector, two-thousand-picul matters;
translations.idiomatic: (The Director of the Two-Thousand-Picul Bureau supervised matters related to Provincial Inspectors and officials with a two-thousand-picul rank.)

sentences.zh: 戶曹尚書，主人庶上書事；

translations.literal: Hu Cao Shangshu, master commoners memorial-writing matters;
translations.idiomatic: (The Director of the Household Bureau supervised memorials submitted by the common people.)

sentences.zh: 主客尚書，主外國四夷事；

translations.literal: Zhu Ke Shangshu, master foreign four Barbarians matters;
translations.idiomatic: (The Director of the Reception Bureau supervised matters related to foreign peoples and the "barbarians" of the four directions.)

sentences.zh: 成帝加三公尚書，主斷獄事。

translations.literal: Cheng Emperor added San Gong Shangshu, master judge prison matters.
translations.idiomatic: (Emperor Cheng added a Director for the Bureau of the Three Excellencies to supervise judicial matters and criminal trials.)

sentences.zh: 僕射，秦官也。

translations.literal: Puye, Qin official also.
translations.idiomatic: (Supervisor (puye) was originally a Qin official title.)

sentences.zh: 僕，主也。

translations.literal: Pu, master also.
translations.idiomatic: (The character pu means to supervise or be in charge.)

sentences.zh: 古者重武事，每官必有主射以督課之。

translations.literal: Ancient ones valued military matters, each office must have master archer to supervise examine them.
translations.idiomatic: (In ancient times, great importance was placed on military readiness; consequently, every office was required to have a "Master of Archery" to supervise and evaluate the training of the staff.)

sentences.zh: 」謝躬為尚書僕射。

translations.literal: " Xie Gong was Shangshu Puye.
translations.idiomatic: (Xie Gong served as the Supervisor of the Secretariat.)

sentences.zh: 光武因大饗士卒，遂東圍鉅鹿。

translations.literal: Guangwu then big feasted soldiers, then east besieged Julu.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Guangwu then held a great feast for his soldiers, after which he moved east to lay siege to Julu.

sentences.zh: 王郎守將王饒堅守，月餘不下。

translations.literal: Wang Lang guarding general Wang Rao firmly guarded, month more not down.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Lang's defending general, Wang Rao, held the city firmly, and after more than a month, it had still not fallen.

sentences.zh: 郎遣將倪宏、劉奉

translations.literal: Lang sent generals Ni Hong, Liu Feng
translations.idiomatic: Wang Lang then dispatched his generals, Ni Hong and Liu Feng,

sentences.zh: 〈倪音五兮反。

translations.literal: Ni sound wu-xi fan.
translations.idiomatic: (The character ni is pronounced ni.)

sentences.zh: 率數萬人救鉅鹿，光武逆戰於南䜌，

translations.literal: led several ten thousand people save Julu, Guangwu met-in-battle at Nanluan,
translations.idiomatic: leading several tens of thousands of men to relieve the siege of Julu. Emperor Guangwu moved to intercept them and engaged them in battle at Nanluan.

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬鉅鹿郡，故城在今邢州柏人縣東北。

translations.literal: County name, belongs to Julu commandery, former city at today Xingzhou Bairen county northeast.
translations.idiomatic: (Nanluan was a county belonging to Julu Commandery; its former city is located northeast of present-day Bairen County in Xingzhou.)

sentences.zh: 左傳齊國夏伐晉取欒，即其地也。

translations.literal: Zuo Zhuan Qi Guo Xia attacked Jin took Luan, is that place also.
translations.idiomatic: (The Zuo Zhuan records that Guo Xia of Qi attacked Jin and captured Luan; this was the same location.)

sentences.zh: 其後南徙，故加「南」。

translations.literal: Its after south moved, therefore added "Nan".
translations.idiomatic: (Since the settlement later moved further south, the word nan [south] was added to its name.)

sentences.zh: 今俗謂之倫城，聲之轉也。

translations.literal: Today common call it Lun city, sound's shift also.
translations.idiomatic: (Today it is commonly called Lun City, which is a phonetic corruption of the original name.)

sentences.zh: 䜌音力全反。

translations.literal: Luan sound li-quan fan.
translations.idiomatic: (The character luan is pronounced luan.)

sentences.zh: 斬首數千級。

translations.literal: Cut heads several thousand levels.
translations.idiomatic: Several thousand heads were taken in the victory.

sentences.zh: 四月，進圍邯鄲，連戰破之。

translations.literal: Fourth month, advanced besieged Handan, continuous fought broke them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, they advanced to besiege Handan and decisively defeated the enemy in a series of battles.

sentences.zh: 五月甲辰，拔其城，誅王郎。

translations.literal: Fifth month Jiachen, captured its city, executed Wang Lang.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiachen day of the fifth month, they captured the city and executed Wang Lang.

sentences.zh: 收文書，得吏人與郎交關謗毀者數千章。

translations.literal: Collected documents, got officials people with Lang interaction slander defame ones several thousand chapters.
translations.idiomatic: They collected various documents and discovered thousands of memorials from officials and commoners that had slandered and defamed the Han in their dealings with Wang Lang.

sentences.zh: 光武不省，會諸將軍燒之，曰：「令反側子自安。」

translations.literal: Guangwu not looked-into, gathered various generals burned them, said: "Let restless ones self peaceful."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Guangwu did not examine them; instead, he gathered his generals and had the documents burned, saying, "Let those who were wavering now find peace of mind."

sentences.zh: 〈反側，不安也。

translations.literal: Fance, not peaceful also.
translations.idiomatic: (The term fance means to be restless or uneasy.)

sentences.zh: 詩國風曰：「展轉反側。

translations.literal: Classic of Poetry Guo Feng says: "Turn roll turn over."
translations.idiomatic: (The Classic of Poetry, in the "Lessons from the States" section, states: "Tossing and turning, restless and uneasy.")

sentences.zh: 更始遣侍御史持節立光武為蕭王，

translations.literal: Gengshi sent Attendant Censor holding tally establish Guangwu as Xiao King,
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gengshi dispatched an Attendant Censor, bearing the imperial tally, to enfeoff Emperor Guangwu as the King of Xiao.

sentences.zh: 〈蕭，縣，屬沛郡，今徐州縣也。

translations.literal: Xiao, county, belongs to Pei commandery, today Xuzhou county also.
translations.idiomatic: (Xiao was a county belonging to Pei Commandery; it is present-day Xiao County in Xuzhou.)

sentences.zh: 《續漢書》曰：「更始使侍御史黃黨封上為蕭王。

translations.literal: "Continued Book of Han" says: "Gengshi sent Attendant Censor Huang Dang enfeoff Emperor as Xiao King.
translations.idiomatic: (The Continued Book of Han states: "Emperor Gengshi sent the Attendant Censor Huang Dang to enfeoff the Emperor as the King of Xiao.")

sentences.zh: 悉令罷兵詣行在所。

translations.literal: All ordered cease troops go-to traveling palace place.
translations.idiomatic: He also ordered that all troops be demobilized and that Emperor Guangwu report to the imperial traveling residence.

sentences.zh: 〈蔡邕獨斷曰：「天子以四海為家，故謂所居為行在所。

translations.literal: Cai Yong Du Duan says: "Son of Heaven takes four seas as home, therefore call what resides traveling palace place.
translations.idiomatic: (Cai Yong states in his Du Duan: "Since the Son of Heaven treats the entire world as his home, wherever he happens to reside is called the 'traveling palace' (xingzaishuo).")

sentences.zh: 光武辭以河北未平，不就徵。

translations.literal: Guangwu declined with the reason that Hebei was not yet pacified, did not accept the summons.
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu declined the summons, citing that Hebei remained unconquered.

sentences.zh: 自是始貳於更始。

translations.literal: From this began to be disloyal toward Gengshi.
translations.idiomatic: From this point onward, Guangwu began to show disloyalty toward Gengshi.

sentences.zh: 〈貳，離異也。

translations.literal: (Er, separation also.)
translations.idiomatic: (Er means separation or disloyalty.)

sentences.zh: 是時長安政亂，四方背叛。

translations.literal: At this time Chang'an government was chaotic, the four directions rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, political chaos reigned in Chang'an and rebellions broke out in all four directions.

sentences.zh: 梁王劉永擅命睢陽，

translations.literal: Liang King Liu Yong acted on his own authority in Suiyang,
translations.idiomatic: King Liu Yong of Liang ruled independently in Suiyang,

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬梁郡，今宋州也。

translations.literal: (County name, belongs to Liang commandery, now Songzhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (Suiyang was a county in Liang commandery, now Songzhou.)

sentences.zh: 擅，專也。

translations.literal: (Shan, monopoly also.)
translations.idiomatic: (Shan means to monopolize or act independently.)

sentences.zh: 公孫述稱王巴蜀，

translations.literal: Gongsun Shu proclaimed himself king of Bashu,
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Shu declared himself king of Bashu,

sentences.zh: 〈蜀有巴郡，故緫言之。

translations.literal: (Shu has Ba commandery, therefore collectively called.)
translations.idiomatic: (Shu contains Ba commandery, hence the collective name Bashu.)

sentences.zh: 李憲自立為淮南王，

translations.literal: Li Xian established himself as King of Huainan,
translations.idiomatic: Li Xian proclaimed himself King of Huainan,

sentences.zh: 〈淮南，郡，今壽州也。

translations.literal: (Huainan, commandery, now Shouzhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (Huainan was a commandery, now Shouzhou.)

sentences.zh: 秦豐自號楚黎王，

translations.literal: Qin Feng called himself King of Chu and Li,
translations.idiomatic: Qin Feng proclaimed himself King of Chu and Li,

sentences.zh: 〈習鑿齒襄陽記曰：「秦豐，黎丘郷人。

translations.literal: (Xi Zaochi's Xiangyang Record states: "Qin Feng was a native of Liqiu Township.")
translations.idiomatic: (Xi Zaochi's Records of Xiangyang states: 'Qin Feng was from Liqiu Township.')

sentences.zh: 黎丘楚地，故稱楚黎王。

translations.literal: Liqiu was in Chu territory, therefore called King of Chu and Li.
translations.idiomatic: Liqiu was located in Chu territory, hence the title King of Chu and Li.

sentences.zh: 」黎丘故城在今襄州率道縣北。

translations.literal: The ancient city of Liqiu is north of present-day Shuidao County in Xiangzhou.
translations.idiomatic: The ruins of ancient Liqiu are located north of modern Shuidao County in Xiangzhou.

sentences.zh: 張步起琅邪，

translations.literal: Zhang Bu rose up in Langye,
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Bu rose in rebellion in Langye,

sentences.zh: 〈郡有琅邪山，故城，今海州朐山縣東北。

translations.literal: (The commandery has Mount Langye; the ancient city is northeast of Qushan County in present-day Haizhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (The commandery contains Mount Langye; its ancient city lies northeast of modern Qushan County in Haizhou.)

sentences.zh: 董憲起東海，

translations.literal: Dong Xian rose up in Donghai,
translations.idiomatic: Dong Xian rose in rebellion in Donghai,

sentences.zh: 〈郡名，今海州縣。

translations.literal: (Commandery name, now Haizhou County.)
translations.idiomatic: (Commandery name, now Haizhou County.)

sentences.zh: 延岑起漢中，

translations.literal: Yan Cen rose up in Hanzhong,
translations.idiomatic: Yan Cen rose in rebellion in Hanzhong,

sentences.zh: 〈郡名，故城在今梁州南鄭縣東北。

translations.literal: (Commandery name; ancient city northeast of Nanzheng County in present-day Liangzhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (Commandery name; its ancient city lies northeast of modern Nanzheng County in Liangzhou.)

sentences.zh: 田戎起夷陵，

translations.literal: Tian Rong rose up in Yiling,
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong rose in rebellion in Yiling,

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬南郡。

translations.literal: (County name, belongs to Nangun.)
translations.idiomatic: (County name, belonging to Nangun.)

sentences.zh: 有夷山，故曰夷陵，今硤州縣也，故城在今縣西北。

translations.literal: There is Yishan Mountain, therefore called Yiling, now Qiaozhou County, ancient city northwest of present-day county.
translations.idiomatic: It contains Mount Yi, hence the name Yiling; now Qiaozhou County, with the ancient city northwest of the modern county.

sentences.zh: 並置將帥，侵略郡縣。

translations.literal: They all appointed generals and commanders, invading and plundering commanderies and counties.
translations.idiomatic: They all established generals and commanders, raiding and pillaging the commanderies and counties.

sentences.zh: 又別號諸賊銅馬、大肜、高湖、重連、鐵脛、大搶、尤來、上江、青犢、五校、檀郷、五幡、五樓、富平、獲索等，

translations.literal: Furthermore, they separately named various bandit groups Copper Horse, Great Shape, High Lake, Heavy Link, Iron Shin, Great Plunder, Especially Come, Upper River, Blue Calf, Five Schools, Tan Township, Five Banners, Five Towers, Rich Plain, Obtain Rope, etc.,
translations.idiomatic: They also separately named various bandit groups: Copper Horse, Great Shape, High Lake, Heavy Link, Iron Shin, Great Plunder, Especially Come, Upper River, Blue Calf, Five Schools, Tan Township, Five Banners, Five Towers, Rich Plain, Obtain Rope, and others,

sentences.zh: 〈諸賊或以山川土地為名，或以軍容彊盛為號。

translations.literal: (The various bandits either took names from mountains, rivers, and lands, or were named for their military appearance and strength.)
translations.idiomatic: (The various bandits either took names from mountains, rivers, and territories, or were named for their formidable military bearing.)

sentences.zh: 銅馬賊帥東山荒禿、上淮況等，大肜渠帥樊重，尤來渠帥樊崇，五校賊帥高扈，檀郷賊帥董次仲，五樓賊帥張文，富平賊帥徐少，獲索賊帥古師郎等，並見東觀記。

translations.literal: Copper Horse bandit leader Dongshan Huangtu, Shang Huaikuang and others, Great Shape leader Fan Chong, Especially Come leader Fan Chong, Five Schools bandit leader Gao Hu, Tan Township bandit leader Dong Cizhong, Five Towers bandit leader Zhang Wen, Rich Plain bandit leader Xu Shao, Obtain Rope bandit leader Gu Shilang and others, all appear in the Records of the Eastern Tower.
translations.idiomatic: Copper Horse bandit leader Dongshan Huangtu, Shang Huaikuang and others; Great Shape leader Fan Chong; Especially Come leader Fan Chong; Five Schools bandit leader Gao Hu; Tan Township bandit leader Dong Cizhong; Five Towers bandit leader Zhang Wen; Rich Plain bandit leader Xu Shao; Obtain Rope bandit leader Gu Shilang and others—all appear in the Records of the Eastern Tower.

sentences.zh: 各領部曲，

translations.literal: Each leading their own divisions and companies,
translations.idiomatic: Each commanding their own divisions and troops,

sentences.zh: 〈《續漢志》曰：「大將軍營有五部，部三校尉。

translations.literal: (The Continued Han Records states: "The Grand General's camp has five divisions, each division has three colonels.)
translations.idiomatic: (The Continued Han Records states: 'The Grand General's camp has five divisions, each with three colonels.')

sentences.zh: 部下有曲，曲有軍候一人。

translations.literal: Under divisions there are companies, each company has one army captain.
translations.idiomatic: Under each division are companies, and each company has one army captain.

sentences.zh: 衆合數百萬人，所在寇掠。

translations.literal: Their combined forces numbered several hundred thousand men, plundering wherever they went.
translations.idiomatic: Their combined forces numbered several hundred thousand, pillaging wherever they appeared.

sentences.zh: 光武將擊之，先遣吳漢北發十郡兵。

translations.literal: Guangwu was about to strike against them, first sending Wu Han north to mobilize troops from ten commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu prepared to attack them, first dispatching Wu Han north to raise troops from ten commanderies.

sentences.zh: 幽州牧苗曾不從，漢遂斬曾而發其衆。

translations.literal: Youzhou Governor Miao Zeng did not comply, so Han then executed Zeng and mobilized his troops.
translations.idiomatic: Governor Miao Zeng of Youzhou refused to comply, so Han executed Zeng and mobilized his forces.

sentences.zh: 秋，光武擊銅馬於鄡，

translations.literal: In autumn, Guangwu attacked the Copper Horse bandits at Qiang,
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Guangwu attacked the Copper Horse bandits at Qiang,

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬鉅鹿郡，故城在今兾州鹿城縣東。

translations.literal: (County name, belongs to Julu commandery, ancient city east of present-day Lucheng County in Jizhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (County name, belonging to Julu commandery; ancient city east of modern Lucheng County in Jizhou.)

sentences.zh: 鄡音苦堯反。

translations.literal: (Qiang is pronounced ku yao fan.)
translations.idiomatic: (Qiang is pronounced ku yao fan.)

sentences.zh: 竹書紀年曰：「衞鞅封于鄡。

translations.literal: (The Bamboo Annals states: "Wei Yang was enfeoffed at Qiang.)
translations.idiomatic: (The Bamboo Annals states: 'Wei Yang was enfeoffed at Qiang.')

sentences.zh: 」臣賢案：下文云「吳漢將突騎來會清陽」，又「追至館陶」，並與鄡相近。

translations.literal: (Minister Xian's commentary: The text below says "Wu Han led the assault cavalry to meet at Qingyang", and "pursued to Guantao", both of which are near Qiang.)
translations.idiomatic: (Minister Xian notes: The text below mentions 'Wu Han led the assault cavalry to meet at Qingyang' and 'pursued to Guantao', both near Qiang.)

sentences.zh: 俗本多誤作「鄔」，而蕭該音一古反，云屬太原郡，臧矜音作鄢，一建反，云屬襄陽郡，並誤也。

translations.literal: (Popular editions often mistakenly write it as "Wu", and Xiao Gai pronounces it yi gu fan, saying it belongs to Taiyuan commandery, Zang Jin pronounces it as Yan, yi jian fan, saying it belongs to Xiangyang commandery, both are wrong.)
translations.idiomatic: (Popular editions often mistakenly write it as 'Wu'; Xiao Gai pronounces it yi gu fan, claiming it belongs to Taiyuan commandery; Zang Jin pronounces it as Yan, yi jian fan, claiming it belongs to Xiangyang commandery—all are incorrect.)

sentences.zh: 吳漢將突騎來會清陽。

translations.literal: Wu Han led the assault cavalry to meet at Qingyang.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Han led the assault cavalry to rendezvous at Qingyang.

sentences.zh: 〈縣名，屬清河郡，今貝州縣，故城在州西北。

translations.literal: (County name, belongs to Qinghe commandery, now Beizhou County, ancient city northwest of the prefecture.)
translations.idiomatic: (County name, belonging to Qinghe commandery; now Beizhou County, with ancient city northwest of the prefecture.)

sentences.zh: 賊數挑戰，

translations.literal: The bandits repeatedly challenged them to battle,
translations.idiomatic: The bandits repeatedly challenged them to combat,

sentences.zh: 〈挺身獨戰也，古謂之致師，見左傳。

translations.literal: (To step forward and fight alone, anciently called "issuing a challenge to battle", see Zuo Commentary.)
translations.idiomatic: (To step forward and fight alone; anciently called 'issuing a challenge to battle'; see the Zuo Commentary.)

sentences.zh: 挑音徒了反。

translations.literal: (Tiao is pronounced tu liao fan.)
translations.idiomatic: (Tiao is pronounced tu liao fan.)

sentences.zh: 光武堅營自守；

translations.literal: Guangwu fortified his camp and defended himself;
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu fortified his camp and held his position;

sentences.zh: 有出鹵掠者，輒擊取之，

translations.literal: Whenever bandits came out to plunder, he would immediately attack and capture them,
translations.idiomatic: Whenever bandits sallied forth to plunder, he would promptly attack and seize them,

sentences.zh: 〈鹵與虜同。

translations.literal: (Lu is the same as lu [captive].)
translations.idiomatic: (Lu means the same as lu [to plunder].)

sentences.zh: 郭璞注爾雅曰：「掠，奪取也。

translations.literal: (Guo Pu's commentary on the Erya states: "Lue means to seize.")
translations.idiomatic: (Guo Pu's commentary on the Erya states: 'Lue means to seize and take.')

sentences.zh: 絕其粮道。

translations.literal: cutting off their grain supply routes.
translations.idiomatic: cutting off their supply lines.

sentences.zh: 積月餘日，賊食盡，夜遁去，追至館陶，大破之。

translations.literal: After more than a month, the bandits' food was exhausted, they fled at night, he pursued them to Guantao, and decisively defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a month, the bandits ran out of food and fled under cover of night; he pursued them to Guantao and inflicted a major defeat.

sentences.zh: 〈館陶，縣，屬魏郡，今魏州縣。

translations.literal: (Guantao, county, belongs to Wei commandery, now Weizhou county.)
translations.idiomatic: (Guantao was a county in Wei commandery, now Weizhou county.)

sentences.zh: 受降未盡，而高湖、重連從東南來，與銅馬餘衆合，光武復與大戰於蒲陽，悉破降之，封其渠帥為列侯。

translations.literal: The surrender was not yet complete, when Gao Hu and Chong Lian came from the southeast, joined with the remaining Copper Horse forces, Guangwu again fought a great battle with them at Puyang, completely defeated and captured them, and enfeoffed their leaders as marquises.
translations.idiomatic: The surrender was still incomplete when Gao Hu and Chong Lian arrived from the southeast, joining forces with the remaining Copper Horse bandits. Guangwu fought another major battle against them at Puyang, decisively defeating them all and enfeoffing their leaders as marquises.

sentences.zh: 〈《前書》音義曰「蒲陽山，蒲水所出」，在今定州北平縣西北。

translations.literal: (The Former Book's pronunciation and meaning states: "Puyang Mountain, source of the Pu River", located northwest of Beiping County in present-day Dingzhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (The Former Book's glossary states: 'Puyang Mountain is the source of the Pu River,' located northwest of modern Beiping County in Dingzhou.)

sentences.zh: 本或作「滿陽」。

translations.literal: (Some versions write it as "Manyang".)
translations.idiomatic: (Some editions write it as 'Manyang'.)

sentences.zh: 渠，大也。

translations.literal: (Qu, great also.)
translations.idiomatic: (Qu means great or chief.)

sentences.zh: 尚書：「殲厥渠魁。

translations.literal: (The Book of Documents: "Slaughter their chief leaders.")
translations.idiomatic: (The Book of Documents states: 'Slaughter their chief leaders.')

sentences.zh: 」列侯即徹侯也。

translations.literal: (Marquises are also called chehou.)
translations.idiomatic: (Marquises are also known as chehou [full marquises].)

sentences.zh: 稱列者，言見序列也。

translations.literal: Calling them lie means they are listed in sequence.)
translations.idiomatic: The term 'lie' means they are listed in the sequence of nobility.)

sentences.zh: 降者猶不自安，光武知其意，勑令各歸營勒兵，乃自乘輕騎按行部陳。

translations.literal: The surrendered still felt uneasy, Guangwu knew their intentions, ordered each to return to their camps and organize troops, then personally rode a light horse to inspect the battle formations.
translations.idiomatic: The surrendered troops still felt unsettled. Guangwu understood their concerns and ordered each group to return to their camps to organize their forces, while he personally rode a light horse to inspect their battle formations.

sentences.zh: 降者更相語曰：「蕭王推赤心置人腹中，安得不投死乎！」

translations.literal: The surrendered ones said to each other: "King Xiao lays bare his true heart in people's bellies, how can we not die for him!"
translations.idiomatic: The surrendered soldiers said among themselves: 'King Xiao lays his true heart bare in our bellies—how can we not die for him!'

sentences.zh: 〈投死猶言致死。

translations.literal: (Tou si is the same as saying to devote oneself to death.)
translations.idiomatic: (Tou si means to devote oneself completely to death.)

sentences.zh: 由是皆服。

translations.literal: From this, all submitted.
translations.idiomatic: From this point onward, all were convinced and submitted.

sentences.zh: 悉將降人分配諸將，衆遂數十萬，故關西號光武為「銅馬帝」。

translations.literal: He completely distributed the surrendered people among the various generals, so the army numbered several hundred thousand, therefore the west of the pass called Guangwu the "Copper Horse Emperor".
translations.idiomatic: He distributed all the surrendered troops among his various generals, swelling his army to several hundred thousand. This is why west of the pass they called Guangwu the 'Copper Horse Emperor.'

sentences.zh: 赤眉別帥與大肜、青犢十餘萬衆在射犬，

translations.literal: The Red Eyebrows' separate commander with Great Shape and Blue Calf, over a hundred thousand troops, were at Shegou,
translations.idiomatic: A separate Red Eyebrow commander, along with the leaders of Great Shape and Blue Calf bands with over a hundred thousand troops, was stationed at Shegou,

sentences.zh: 〈《續漢志》曰野王縣有射犬聚，故城在今懷州武德縣北也。

translations.literal: (The Continued Han Records says Yewang County has Shegou settlement, ancient city north of modern Wude County in Huai Prefecture.)
translations.idiomatic: (The Continued Han Records states that Yewang County contains the Shegou settlement; its ancient site lies north of modern Wude County in Huai Prefecture.)

sentences.zh: 光武進擊，大破之，衆皆散走。

translations.literal: Guangwu advanced and attacked, greatly defeated them, the troops all scattered and fled.
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu advanced and attacked, decisively defeating them. Their troops scattered and fled in all directions.

sentences.zh: 使吳漢、岑彭襲殺謝躬於鄴。

translations.literal: He sent Wu Han and Cen Peng to attack and kill Xie Gong at Ye.
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched Wu Han and Cen Peng to attack and assassinate Xie Gong at Ye.

sentences.zh: 青犢、赤眉賊入函谷關，攻更始。

translations.literal: The Blue Calf and Red Eyebrows bandits entered the Hangu Pass, attacking Gengshi.
translations.idiomatic: The Blue Calf and Red Eyebrow bandits entered Hangu Pass and attacked Gengshi.

sentences.zh: 〈函谷，谷名，因谷以名關。

translations.literal: (Hangu is a valley name, the pass is named after the valley.)
translations.idiomatic: (Hangu is the name of a valley; the pass takes its name from the valley.)

sentences.zh: 舊在弘農湖城縣西，《前書》楊僕為樓船將軍，有功，恥居關外，武帝乃為徒於新安。

translations.literal: Formerly west of Hucheng County in Hongnong, the Former Book says Yang Pu was Tower Ship General, had merit, was ashamed to live outside the pass, Emperor Wu then moved it to Xin'an.
translations.idiomatic: It was formerly located west of Hucheng County in Hongnong. The Former Book states that Yang Pu served as Tower Ship General and, having achieved merit, was ashamed to live outside the pass. Emperor Wu then relocated it to Xin'an.

sentences.zh: 故關在今洛州新安縣之東。

translations.literal: Therefore the pass is east of modern Xin'an County in Luo Prefecture.
translations.idiomatic: Hence the pass is located east of modern Xin'an County in Luo Prefecture.

sentences.zh: 光武乃遣鄧禹率六裨將引兵而西，以乘更始、赤眉之亂。

translations.literal: Guangwu then sent Deng Yu leading six deputy generals to lead troops westward, to take advantage of the chaos between Gengshi and the Red Eyebrows.
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu then dispatched Deng Yu, commanding six deputy generals, to lead troops west and exploit the turmoil between Gengshi and the Red Eyebrows.

sentences.zh: 時更始使大司馬朱鮪、舞陰王李軼等屯洛陽，

translations.literal: At this time Gengshi sent Grand Marshal Zhu Wei, King of Wuyin Li Yi and others to station at Luoyang,
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Gengshi dispatched Grand Marshal Zhu Wei, King Li Yi of Wuyin, and others to garrison Luoyang,

sentences.zh: 〈舞陰，縣，屬南陽郡，故城在今唐州沘陽縣西北。

translations.literal: (Wuyin, county, belongs to Nanyang commandery, ancient city northwest of modern Biyang County in Tang Prefecture.)
translations.idiomatic: (Wuyin was a county in Nanyang commandery; its ancient site lies northwest of modern Biyang County in Tang Prefecture.)

sentences.zh: 光武亦令馮異守孟津以拒之。

translations.literal: Guangwu also ordered Feng Yi to defend Mengjin to resist them.
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu also commanded Feng Yi to defend Mengjin and hold them back.

sentences.zh: 〈孔安國注尚書云：「孟，地名，在洛北，都道所湊，古今以為津。

translations.literal: (Kong Anguo's commentary on the Book of Documents states: "Meng, place name, north of Luo, where all roads converge, ancient and modern consider it a ford.)
translations.idiomatic: (Kong Anguo's commentary on the Book of Documents states: 'Meng is a place name north of Luo where all roads converge; both ancient and modern times consider it a river crossing.)

sentences.zh: 」論衡曰：「武王伐紂，八百諸侯同於此盟，故曰盟津。

translations.literal: (Lunheng says: "When King Wu attacked Zhou, eight hundred feudal lords allied here, therefore called Mengjin.)
translations.idiomatic: (The Lunheng states: 'When King Wu attacked Zhou, eight hundred feudal lords formed their alliance here, hence it is called Mengjin.)

sentences.zh: 」俗名治戍津，今河陽縣津也。

translations.literal: (Popularly called Zhishu Ford, now the ford at Heyang County.)
translations.idiomatic: (It is popularly called Zhishu Ford, and is now the river crossing at Heyang County.)

sentences.zh: 光武北擊尤來、大搶、五幡於元氏，追至右北平，連破之。

translations.literal: Guangwu struck north against Especially Come, Great Plunder, Five Banners at Yuanshi, pursued to Right Beiping, successively defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: Guangwu attacked north against the Especially Come, Great Plunder, and Five Banners forces at Yuanshi, pursuing them to Right Beiping where he successively defeated them.

sentences.zh: 〈北平，縣，屬中山國，今易州永樂縣也。

translations.literal: (Beiping, county, belongs to Zhongshan Principality, now Yongle County in Yizhou.)
translations.idiomatic: (Beiping was a county in the Principality of Zhongshan, now Yongle County in Yizhou.)

sentences.zh: 臣賢案：東觀記、續漢書並無「右」字，此加「右」，誤也。

translations.literal: (Minister Xian's commentary: The Records of the Eastern Tower and Continued Book of Han both have no "right" character, this addition of "right" is a mistake.)
translations.idiomatic: (Minister Xian notes: Neither the Records of the Eastern Tower nor the Continued Book of Han include the character 'right'; this addition is erroneous.)

sentences.zh: 營州西南別有右北平郡故城，非此地。

translations.literal: Ying Prefecture southwest separately has Right Beiping commandery ancient city, not this place.
translations.idiomatic: There is separately a Right Beiping commandery ancient city southwest of Ying Prefecture, which is not this location.

sentences.zh: 又戰於順水北，

translations.literal: Again battled north of Shun River,
translations.idiomatic: He fought another battle north of the Shun River,
